title: The week in wildlife - in pictures
text:
A new recruit wrestles with an instructor during an anti-bullying exercise as part of the selection process for the Akashinga ranger training programme in Phundundu, Zimbabwe. The programme was started in Phundundu wildlife area in the lower Zambezi ecosystem. It builds an alternative approach to the militarised paradigm of ‘fortress conservation’ which defends colonial boundaries between nature and humans. While still trained to deal with any situation, the team works with, rather than against, the local population for the long-term benefits of their communities and nature.

Photograph: Gianluigi Guercia/AFP/Getty Images
